reviews.review_msg:
Very kind professor, extremely supportive - the final essay requirement is 10 pages though so that's quite a tough ask for a 100 level course.

Kindhearted and positive person. :)

Very nice and caring professor, good at answering questions from students, and not a tough grader by any means. It's not hard to get a good grade. My only two complaints are that he's a tad boring in his lectures in my opinion, and focused a bit too much on labour history in this class than other aspects of history. The textbook is long.
Excellent professor who really cares about his students and their learning experience.
Excellent class, interesting lectures and engaging discussions. Very relevant class with content that can apply to future classes and life in general. Really cares about students doing well.

Very funny prof and gives lots of extra time to complete any material. That being said, his lectures are extremely boring, he gets off track regularly, and he reads directly from the PowerPoint. He is also a very hard marker, which you don't realize from his teaching style in class.

Hard marker but he is such an amazing person. In my 4 years of university, I have noticed that John-Henry Harter has been the only professor who genuinely cares about the well-being of his students. He understands when students need extra time to complete assignments due to things going on in their personal lives. His compassion is truly amazing.
Dr. Harter is probably the best professor Ive ever had - he keeps the course material super engaging and has very clear class expectations. Grades fair. Isnt afraid to crack a joke either!

I really loved Professor Harter. He was very kind, understanding and answered any questions I had regarding course questions/grading. If you have questions, just ask, don't assume. He was very communicative (e-mail), clear and the course was well structured. Probably one of my favourite professors I've had so far in the 5 years I've attended SFU.
He marks everything easy before the evaluation, so we can give him nice feedback. In fact, he is a tough grader for international students. He just wants to make some easy money.

John-Henry is an engaging, fun lecturer with a formidable knowledge of Canadian history and politics. His class roleplaying scenarios, where groups of students portray opposing sides from true historical events, are unique and informative on a level not often experienced during lectures. When students bothered to engage, lectures were great!
tough grader, with unclear grading scale.
Never gives efficient feedbacks for assignments till you come to talk to him. tough grader with unclear grading scales.
The grading scale is not clear and not fair at all

Difficult to understand what he wants from assignments. Discussions based on Canada only, so if you're a foreigner, it'll be hard to engage. Canceled our class right before the term paper submission, so we could not ask questions. Takes ages to reply emails.
Criteria is actually all laid out in syllabus. Great lectures. Takes students seriously and tries to answer all questions. One of the best profs at SFU.
Doesn't have a clear grading criteria. He lectures in a confusing fashion. Takes 1 month to return the first assignment. Unable to know how you're doing until it's too late.

Nice guy, tries to keep the lecture interesting for some very dry material. Course is mostly centered around tutorial work (3 mini papers, participation, + 1 large paper) so communicate with TA. His exams are fair.
This guy is one of the worst teacher you can find in SFU, all the assignment you submitted, you will get the grade like 1 month later. He mark everything just based on his own interest.

John-Henry is a caring prof that encourages questions in class and lays out a clear syllabus at the start of the semester. However, I found his lectures to be a little dry, he cancelled the morning of the lecture twice, and shows an obvious political bias when he's teaching. There's no final, so it's a good elective to balance your course load.
He goes through lecture very quickly, sometimes it's very hard to understand or keep up. Unclear about sources in research project. Marking is harsh, and assignments are returned late.

It's hard to do well in this class since the assignments are mostly returned several weeks after submission. His teaching style could be improved from being dry to more engaging. When it comes to exams, some clarity about the topics covered would definitely help.

Great teacher if you care about the material, very open to students expressing their opinions and having group discussions. If you aren't prepared to participate this class isn't for you. Responsive to emails, and willing to talk after class.

Probably the most kind, caring, hilarious prof in the world. He goes above and beyond to make even the most boring topics entertaining. His review sheets for exams are amazing and as long as you follow them you will do well. His papers are enjoyable as well and he gives amazing feedback. 20/10 recommend to anyone even if you don't like history.

John-Henry is one of the few professors that will make you work for it, yet attempt to understand his students. Incredibly passionate yet, if you engage with him, attempts to understand views that conflict with his own. Open to various interpretations of class, not set in Labour studies. Does take time to grade, but, is so he views each film. Enjoy

John Henry is amazing! He makes lectures fun to attend. However, he is a tough marker and there is a 10+ page essay you have to complete by the end of semester. All tests and assignments are written, so if you're not the best at writing, I wouldn't recommend this course for you.

John-Henry is a hilarious, caring professor. He makes an effort to clarify and be accessible after class. Do read the textbook; it helps to re-iterate what was said during lectures. John-Henry uses PowerPoints while he lectures, which is very helpful. He has a passion for Canadian history and makes it interesting and clear to understand. Awesome!

John-Henry is an amazing prof, he is willing to help and is easily accessible outside of class, either through email or in person during office hours. He makes lectures fun and interesting by telling jokes. I would definitely recommend taking a history class with him.

John-Henry is the most genuine prof I have ever met! He makes Canadian history super interesting and is a fantastic lecturer. Really engaging with his jokes and is such a nice guy. SFU needs to hire him on as faculty ASAP!!

He tries to make lectures interesting by bringing in historical videos, excerpts, pictures, etc. Definitely recommend if youre looking for a B-Hum/W elective. John-Henry is always available for additional help. Great prof + great class overall. Tutorial attendance mandatory. Breakdown  2 papers (35) + tut (10) + mt (25) + F (30). Textbook useful

He is very funny. I mean it's history, so the lecture content isn't the most amazing thing ever. But he tries to make it interesting with his comical jokes. Attendance is required in tutorial but I got a pretty good one who's a good marker. Didn't have to study as much as I expected. Also, he gives you the complete outline of the exams!
He's an amazing prof and is hilarious. He's tells you exactly whats on the midterm and final and the TA's are super reasonable and accessible during office hours. Really good GPA booster!

John-Henry was an excellent professor! He has a great sense of humor and makes Canadian history fun. Papers were very clear and his marking was fair. No tests either! Would definitely recommend a class with him.

John Henry is a super down to earth professor, one who changes the course to fit the needs of the class at will. Definitely would take again. Can't comment on lower level classes, but a must-take for HIST majors in 3rd or 4th year

He was a great prof to have to learn about Canadian History.  He made it as interesting as it could be with jokes and such.  Always was let off 15-20 minutes early.  Also, he was very understanding and accommodating about reading over midterms and papers to change marks from TA's.  I would highly recommend taking a lecture with Harter.

John-Henry is an AMAZING lecturer. He's clearly passionate and knowledgeable about the material plus he's hilarious - love the dad jokes! Plus, he has a tendency to let you out of class 20-30 minutes early. He gives you an outline for what to study for the MT and final - easy class and SO enjoyable! 10/10 would recommend.

His lectures are absolutely entertaining and informative. His teaching style is interactive and witty. Exams are very straight forward as he tells you what to expect.  One of the finest professors at SFU.  Would highly recommend anyone to take his course. There is no better way to learn the real Canadian History than with him.

As first year student, it was refreshing to have such an educated man who was also hilarious (debatable on whether or it it was good funny or just bad puns that are enjoyable). As someone interested in this topic of History, it was great to have him as my professor, as he was obviously interested in it deeply as well.

John-Henry is an amazing professor.  His lectures are entertaining and informative.  He highlights different ideas which may be on the final exam which is extremely helpful.  He clearly cares about all of his students and wants them to succeed.  Overall, I would highly recommend him.

John Henry is the only teacher who could make Canadian pre confederation history enjoyable. He's a hilarious teacher and I would definitely take all the classes I could with him again. He's very straightforward so you know exactly what to expect on tests. The actual information isn't that interesting but he's an awesome and very fair teacher.

John-Henry is amazing! He's always willing to help, he's very passionate about what he teaches and is highly knowledgable about Labour Studies. He is a fair marker, so make sure to put your best effort into your assignments. Expect to participate in every class, if you don't it will affect your grade. Would definitely take another course with him!

I thought I'd hate his labour history course, but I really love it! He is so passionate, engaging, and knowledgeable I look forward to his class even after 5 hours of class and tutorial every Monday. He is a super friendly guy who is very quick to provide helpanswer questions and is very respectful of all opinions, even those he doesn't agree with

I am a first year and this was my favourite class. The lecture is not very mandatory because he posts his slides and it is basically a summary of the textbook. He is a funny guy and his lecture is easy to understand, we always get off earlier too. The marking depends on the TA, I learned don't be scared to participate and analyze w your opinion!

Harter's a good prof. Tends to go off-topic and ramble at times but he's very entertaining. Ended pretty much every HIST 101 lecture 20-40 minutes early, so keep that in mind when building your schedule. Mark was based on the midterm, final, two short papers, one longer paper, & tutorial participation. Outlines exactly what will  be on his tests.

John Henry is a very good professor, he tries to really engage his students in discussion's and encourages questions. Marks decently hard, took participation marks so make sure to get involved in the discussions. He is very open and helpful with assignments if you need it. Defiantly the best professor i have had at SFU, and i would take again.
Very clear about what you'll be tested on, tutorials planned well to supplement lecture. Looking forward to taking another class with him!

John-Henry is very enthusiastic about teaching labour studies. His assignments and mid-term are very straightforward, make sure you read the texts before class as he likes to engage in group discussions. He is very helpful and always available to discuss and questions you might have. I highly recommend taking any class taught by him!

John-Henry is HILARIOUS, loved his lectures very engaging if you like Canadian History, and even if you don't then you'll still like him. He tells you exactly what will be on the exam, so if you go to lecture you'll get a good grade
Took Pre Confederation Canadian History 101 with this guy and, though he sure likes to ramble, he is an *awesome* prof. If you're a pdp student looking for your Canadian history credit: this guy.

If you attend lectures and pay attention you're bound to pass.  He's funny and interesting. His midterms are really straightforward and pretty easy, if I do say so.  Makes History fun, interesting and multi-faceted

John Henry is hands down the best professor I've ever had. He actually teaches you, and makes class engaging and fun. He marks moderately hard, and is very open to new ideas, opinions and discussion. I love how debate is welcomed in this class. I advise anyone to take his classes!

Engaging and interesting personality, but extremely bias and narrow minded. Does not have clear expectations and marks labour studies exam as a history exam. Very specific and subjective expectations. Takes more than 3 days to respond to email.

Plain and simple, John-Henry is the greatest professor of all time. He's extremely kind, and actually cares about the well being of his students. Study what he goes over in lecture and you will do very well on tests and in the course.

John-Henry is a really nice prof! In fact his 102W course is what should be the standards of an SFU 100 level course. Really helpful and funny and he tells you what is on the exams. If you have a problem be honest with him and tell him and he will help you resort the issue. Lectures are awesome since he jokes around and overall very chill.

This is my last term before graduation. There is no question in my mind that JHH is THE best prof I've ever had. Course load is fair, grading is fair. If you have an issue (late paper etc) just talk to him and tell him the truth. Hes a good teacher, but an even better human being. Take his class, you'll be pleased you did.

Professor Harter is very passionate about history, you can automatically tell. Hist is not my cup of tea so sometimes I don't attend lectures but as long as you read the textbook, you should do well on his tests. (He tells you what's on the test!) Very funny and when I do attend class, he makes it entertaining an interesting.

seriously great proff! first class where i've felt like having less-than-conservative views was okay, and my opinion would be valued. Wasn't looking forward to class at first-canadian history- but i actually find myself looking forward to lectures and ENJOYING them. Great, helpful proff!!

One of the kindest profs at SFU. Sometimes talks for too long, but is interesting, fair, and listens to all viewpoints. My only complaint is that he sometimes maybe marks a little tooo easily. But it makes for a nice change.

I took this course as an elective. You don't even have to read the book to do well in his tests. You just need to study the topics that he tells you that might be on the exams.really helpful and always enthusiastic in history.
take any of his classes. that is all.

He is absolutely AMAZING. First teacher to make me want to change the world and has definitely made a lasting impression on me. He makes the class super interesting and the class work is a breeze because of it. Definitely going to be taking more classes in the field and hopefully with him!

Very good orator. Will intelligently debate any student's questions and ensure the entire class understands before moving on. Makes claims that will cause one to re-evaluate their faith in the capitalist marketplace, BUT ALWAYS backs up these claims with numerous arguments, causing dissenters to have to conjure up intelligent arguments of their own

I'm over halfway through the class, and I've had only two lectures. All the other classes have been movies, discussions, etc. I don't know about other classes, but for Labour Studies, he doesn't have a TA, he teaches the class himself. Really interesting class, and he's really good at answering questions and discussion.

Take any class you can with John-Henry. He is the coolest. Challenging but always willing to spend endless amounts of time talking/emailing you through a problem. Uses lots of film and alternative methods. Super prof.
Clear, concise, consolidated, and hot.
good guy
Excellent prof. Challenging, but very encouraging, and VERY fair. Class discussion was great. Probably some of the most relevant/interesting material of any class I've taken.
a nice guy...over all a great prof
No Comments
